text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

text: Buy the ticket, take the ride.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: You only live once, but if you do it right once is enough.
author: Mae West

text: Above all, try something.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: I never worry about the future. It comes soon enough.
author: Albert Einstein

text: One who makes no mistakes makes nothing at all.
author: Giacomo Casanova

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: In the end, it’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: If I’d followed all the rules, I’d never have gotten anywhere.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Action expresses priorities.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

text: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Life is short and unpredictable. You might as well laugh, smile, and enjoy it.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Don’t count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: It’s not the years in life that count. It’s the life in your years.
author: Edward J. Stieglitz

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: If you want something you never had, you must be willing to do something you’ve never done.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Leap, and the net will appear.
author: John Burroughs

text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn’t do than by the ones you did do.
author: Mark Twain

text: Life is what happens when you’re busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: Dream as if you’ll live forever. Live as if you’ll die today.
author: James Dean

text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: You can’t go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

text: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William B. Sprague

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Go the extra mile, it’s never crowded.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: Wake up with determination. Go to bed with satisfaction.
author: George Lorimer

text: Believe in yourself and all that you are.
author: Christian D. Larson

text: Chase the vision, not the money; the money will end up following you.
author: Tony Hsieh

text: Don’t limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
author: Jerry Dunn

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Ryun

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: If you really look closely, most overnight successes took a long time.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Don’t count the days; make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after another.
author: Walter Elliot

text: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
author: Anonymous

text: If you stumble, make it part of the dance.
author: Martha Graham

text: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: William Faulkner

text: Do what you feel in your heart to be right, for you’ll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Happiness is not by chance, but by choice.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: If you don’t like the road you’re walking, start paving another one.
author: Dolly Parton

text: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: When one door of happiness closes, another opens.
author: Helen Keller

text: Tough times never last. But tough people do.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
author: Henry Ford

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Take risks: if you win, you will be happy; if you lose, you will be wise.
author: Anonymous

text: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
author: Suzy Kassem

text: To live will be an awfully big adventure.
author: Peter Pan

text: Life is short, and it is here to be lived.
author: Kate Winslet

text: Make each day your masterpiece.
author: John Wooden

text: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Your life does not get better by chance. It gets better by change.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Don’t pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: We generate fears while we sit. We overcome them by action.
author: Dr. Henry Link

text: You don’t need to see the whole path. Just believe in the first step.
author: Unknown

text: In the end, we only regret the chances we didn’t take.
author: Lewis Carroll

text: Don’t be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

text: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

text: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
author: H. G. Wells

text: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

text: Don’t let the fear of striking out hold you back.
author: Babe Ruth

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Challenges are what make life interesting and overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
author: Joshua J. Marine

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Don’t aspire to make a living, aspire to make a difference.
author: Denzel Washington

text: Stay foolish to stay sane.
author: Maxime Lagacé

text: You can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will.
author: Stephen King

text: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
author: John Wooden

text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

text: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

text: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.
author: Babe Ruth

text: Life is short. Live it.
author: Katharine Hepburn

text: In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

text: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Challenges are what make life interesting; overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
author: Joshua Marine

text: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Life isn’t about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: The only way around is through.
author: Robert Frost

text: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
author: E.E. Cummings

text: Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.
author: Grandma Moses

text: Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving.
author: Conrad Hilton

text: To succeed in life, you need two things: ignorance and confidence.
author: Mark Twain

text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
author: Charles Kingsleigh

text: Life moves pretty fast. If you don’t stop and look around once in a while, you could miss it.
author: Ferris Bueller

text: The biggest risk is not taking any risk.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

text: Embrace the glorious mess that you are.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

text: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Fill your life with adventures, not things. Have stories to tell rather than stuff to show.
author: Anonymous

text: Run when you can, walk when you have to, crawl if you must; just never give up.
author: Dean Karnazes

text: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: To travel is to live.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: Life is a journey that must be traveled no matter how bad the roads and accommodations.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

text: Travel far enough, you meet yourself.
author: David Mitchell

text: Life is about making an impact, not making an income.
author: Kevin Kruse

text: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
author: Colin R. Davis

text: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: It’s never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Life isn’t about waiting for the storm to pass, it’s about learning how to dance in the rain.
author: Vivian Greene

text: The only journey is the one within.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Life isn’t measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
author: Anonymous

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.
author: Malcolm X

text: You can never cross the ocean until you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Christopher Columbus

text: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

text: Life is really about how you see it.
author: Unknown

text: Live life to the fullest, and focus on the positive.
author: Matt Cameron

text: Go out on a limb. That’s where the fruit is.
author: Jimmy Carter

text: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: William Faulkner

text: Be fearless in the pursuit of what sets your soul on fire.
author: Jennifer Lee

text: Do what you love, and the money will follow.
author: Marsha Sinetar

text: The secret to getting ahead is getting started.
author: Agatha Christie

text: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Success is not the absence of failure; it’s the persistence through failure.
author: Aisha Tyler

text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Set your goals high, and don’t stop till you get there.
author: Bo Jackson

text: Be so good they can’t ignore you.
author: Steve Martin

text: Life is made of ever so many partings welded together.
author: Charles Dickens

text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: From small beginnings come great things.
author: Proverb

text: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A.A. Milne

text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadow.
author: Helen Keller

text: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: One sees clearly only with the heart. Anything essential is invisible to the eyes.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: Carpe diem. Seize the day, boys.
author: Dead Poets Society

text: Adventure may hurt you but monotony will kill you.
author: Unknown

text: Great things never come from comfort zones.
author: Anonymous

text: What gets us into trouble is not what we don’t know, it’s what we know for sure that just ain’t so.
author: Mark Twain

text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act; the rest is merely tenacity.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Live in the moment and make it so beautiful that it will be worth remembering.
author: Fanny Crosby

text: Life’s not about expecting, hoping and wishing, it’s about doing, being and becoming.
author: Unknown

text: It’s not what you look at that matters, it’s what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Hold the vision, trust the process.
author: Unknown

text: Become who you are by learning who you are and changing who you are to be more who you are.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: I've failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

text: The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
author: Walter Bagehot

text: Live life to the fullest and focus on the positive.
author: Matt Cameron

text: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Never let your memories be greater than your dreams.
author: Doug Ivester

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes later becomes never. Do it now.
author: Anonymous

text: The best view comes after the hardest climb.
author: Unknown

text: A ship is safe in harbor, but that’s not what ships are for.
author: William Shedd

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.
author: Farrah Gray

text: If you’re offered a seat on a rocket ship, don’t ask what seat! Just get on.
author: Sheryl Sandberg

text: Don’t let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.
author: Babe Ruth

text: Think big and don’t listen to people who tell you it can’t be done. Life’s too short to think small.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
author: Sean Patrick Flanery

text: Stop being afraid of what could go wrong and start being excited about what could go right.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Life’s too mysterious to take too serious.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: Challenges are gifts that force us to search for a new center of gravity. Don’t fight them. Just find a new way to stand.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The best dreams happen when you’re awake.
author: Cherie Gilderbloom

text: Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
author: Mother Teresa

text: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Not all who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

text: Life’s too short to wait.
author: Unknown

text: The journey not the arrival matters.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Live for today, plan for tomorrow, party tonight.
author: Unknown

text: The best way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: Life is short, make it count.
author: Anonymous

text: Live your life by a compass, not a clock.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: Take the risk or lose the chance.
author: Anonymous

text: A ship is safe in harbor, but that’s not what ships are built for.
author: John A. Shedd

text: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
author: Robert Byrne

text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
author: Les Brown

text: If you want to fly give up everything that weighs you down.
author: Buddha

text: Adventure is worthwhile.
author: Aesop

text: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
author: Coco Chanel

text: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Live each day as if your life had just begun.
author: Goethe

text: Life is short, do stuff that matters.
author: Unknown

text: It’s not about having time. It’s about making time.
author: Unknown

text: Dream big. Work hard. Stay focused.
author: Unknown

text: You don’t have to be perfect to be amazing.
author: Unknown

text: Life is tough, but so are you.
author: Unknown

text: Choose to shine.
author: Unknown

text: Believe in yourself.
author: Unknown

text: Do it with passion or not at all.
author: Rosa Nouchette Carey

text: Be the energy you want to attract.
author: Unknown

text: Live without regrets.
author: Unknown

text: Stay curious, stay humble.
author: Unknown

text: Collect moments, not things.
author: Unknown

text: The best is yet to come.
author: Unknown

text: Your vibe attracts your tribe.
author: Unknown

text: Fortune favors the bold.
author: Virgil

text: Life is short, have fun.
author: Unknown

text: Embrace uncertainty.
author: Unknown

text: Make today amazing.
author: Unknown

text: Choose joy.
author: Unknown

text: Live without limits.
author: Unknown

text: Seek adventures that open your mind.
author: Unknown

text: Dare to be different.
author: Unknown

text: Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Be present in all things.
author: Unknown

text: Take the road less traveled.
author: Robert Frost

text: Be bold. Be brave. Be you.
author: Unknown

text: Follow your heart.
author: Unknown

text: Every day is a second chance.
author: Unknown

text: Stay wild.
author: Unknown

text: Find beauty in the small things.
author: Unknown

text: Be your own kind of beautiful.
author: Unknown

text: Do more of what makes you happy.
author: Unknown

text: Life’s an adventure, enjoy the ride.
author: Unknown

text: Never stop exploring.
author: Unknown

text: Choose to be happy.
author: Unknown

text: Seek what sets your soul on fire.
author: Unknown

text: Be a voice, not an echo.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Your only limit is you.
author: Unknown

text: Live a life you will remember.
author: Unknown

text: Life is a gift, unwrap it with joy.
author: Unknown

text: Choose adventure over comfort.
author: Unknown

text: Stay hungry. Stay foolish.
author: Steve Jobs

text: You are capable of amazing things.
author: Unknown

text: Journey over destination.
author: Unknown

text: Live life with no excuses, travel with no regret.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Adventure awaits.
author: Unknown

text: Create your own sunshine.
author: Unknown

text: Life is better when you’re laughing.
author: Unknown

text: Be a warrior, not a worrier.
author: Unknown

text: The sky’s not the limit, your mind is.
author: Unknown

text: Life is short. Do something amazing today.
author: Unknown

text: Seek respect, not attention. It lasts longer.
author: Ziad K. Abdelnour

text: The pain you feel today will be the strength you feel tomorrow.
author: Anonymous

text: Your time is now.
author: Unknown

text: Nothing worth having comes easy.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Don’t wait for opportunity. Create it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Rise up and attack the day with enthusiasm.
author: Unknown

text: Make every day count.
author: Anonymous

text: You must go on adventures to find out where you truly belong.
author: Sue Fitzmaurice

text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: If we were meant to stay in one place, we'd have roots instead of feet.
author: Rachel Wolchin

text: Only those who risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn't do than by the ones you did.
author: Mark Twain

text: Take only memories, leave only footprints.
author: Chief Seattle

text: Jobs fill your pocket, but adventures fill your soul.
author: Jaime Lyn Beatty

text: Say yes, and you'll figure it out afterward.
author: Tina Fey

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you've imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Leap and the net will appear.
author: John Burroughs

text: Don't ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive, and go do it.
author: Howard Thurman

text: If not now, when?
author: — Anon

text: To travel is to take a journey into yourself.
author: Danny Kaye

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Dare greatly.
author: Theodore Roosevelt (paraphrase)

text: Feel the fear, and do it anyway.
author: Susan Jeffers

text: All journeys have secret destinations of which the traveler is unaware.
author: Martin Buber

text: Life's too short to play it safe.
author: — Anon

text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Mae West

text: Embrace the detours.
author: Kevin Kelly

text: Great things never came from comfort zones.
author: — Anon

text: Live the life you love. Love the life you live.
author: Bob Marley

text: I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.
author: Susan Sontag

text: Adventure is not outside man; it is within.
author: George Eliot

text: If you obey all the rules, you miss all the fun.
author: Katharine Hepburn

text: I'd rather die while I'm living than live while I'm dead.
author: Jimmy Buffett

text: One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure.
author: William Feather

text: Don't be pushed by your problems. Be led by your dreams.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is short and the world is wide.
author: Simon Raven

text: Adventure is dangerously fun.
author: — Anon

text: Live with no excuses and travel with no regrets.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Fill your life with adventures, not things. Have stories to tell, not stuff to show.
author: — Anon

text: Only the adventurous know the true taste of life.
author: — Anon

text: When was the last time you did something for the first time?
author: — Anon

text: Adventure should be part of everyone's life.
author: Sean Connery

text: Don't be afraid of change. You may lose something good, but you may gain something better.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Live for the moments you can't put into words.
author: — Anon

text: Move out of your comfort zone. You can only grow if you are willing to feel awkward and uncomfortable when you try something new.
author: Brian Tracy

text: You don't have to be rich to travel well.
author: Eugene Fodor

text: It's not the destination, but the courage to journey that counts.
author: — Anon

text: Adventure works best in pairs.
author: — Anon

text: Ascend every mountain, ford every stream, follow every rainbow, 'til you find your dream.
author: Julie Andrews

text: Some of the best memories are made in flip flops.
author: Kellie Elmore

text: We wander for distraction, but we travel for fulfillment.
author: Hilaire Belloc

text: Live life with no regrets, only lessons.
author: — Anon

text: A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for.
author: John A. Shedd

text: Every sunrise is an invitation for us to arise and brighten someone's day.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich

text: To awaken alone in a strange town is one of the pleasantest sensations in the world.
author: Freya Stark

text: Don't count the days; make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.
author: Will Rogers

text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Collect stars, not things.
author: — Anon

text: There is no remedy for love but to love more.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Make every day your masterpiece.
author: John Wooden

text: Dare to live the life you've always wanted.
author: Unknown

text: If you never go, you'll never know.
author: — Anon

text: Big journeys begin with small steps.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Travel brings power and love back into your life.
author: Rumi

text: Leave nothing but footprints, take nothing but photos, kill nothing but time.
author: — Anon

text: Adventure: the pursuit of life.
author: — Anon

text: Be where your feet are, not where your phone is.
author: — Anon

text: Life belongs to the living.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Don't just exist—live.
author: — Anon

text: Follow your heart and the universe will open doors for you.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Better to see something once than hear about it a thousand times.
author: Asian Proverb

text: Wander often. Wonder always.
author: — Anon

text: The journey is the destination.
author: Dan Eldon

text: If we were meant to stay in one place we'd have roots instead of feet.
author: Rachel Wolchin

text: Life is short and world is wide.
author: Simon Raven

text: Embrace uncertainty. Some of the most beautiful chapters in our lives won't have a title until much later.
author: Bob Goff

text: All you need is a passport and an open heart.
author: — Anon

text: Escape the ordinary.
author: — Anon

text: Run wild, live freely.
author: — Anon

text: Break away from the familiar.
author: — Anon

text: Step into the unknown.
author: — Anon

text: Chase horizons, not deadlines.
author: — Anon

text: Don't notice the barricades, just run.
author: — Anon

text: Live loud, travel far.
author: — Anon

text: Find joy in the journey.
author: — Anon

text: Be present in all things and thankful for all things.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The biggest risk is not taking one.
author: — Anon

text: Life is an adventure—dare it.
author: Mother Teresa (paraphrase)

text: Pack light, travel far, return richer.
author: — Anon

text: Live the question.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Be brave enough to live creatively.
author: — Anon

text: Find yourself in new places.
author: — Anon

text: Start somewhere.
author: — Anon

text: Run toward your fears.
author: — Anon

text: Embrace the wild within.
author: — Anon

text: Adventure awaits, go find it.
author: — Anon

text: Say yes to new adventures.
author: — Anon

text: Let curiosity be your compass.
author: — Anon

text: Leap into the unknown.
author: — Anon

text: Sail beyond the horizon.
author: — Anon

text: Run free, run far.
author: — Anon

text: Taste life in every bite.
author: — Anon

text: Climb every mountain.
author: — Anon

text: Risk it all for the story.
author: — Anon

text: Be untamed.
author: — Anon

text: Dance with the world.
author: — Anon

text: Live wide awake.
author: — Anon

text: Go run free.
author: — Anon

text: Adventure is calling.
author: — Anon

text: Discover your wild.
author: — Anon

text: Embrace the journey.
author: — Anon

text: Leap and live.
author: — Anon

text: Risk more than others think is safe.
author: — Anon

text: Feel alive today.
author: — Anon

text: Go where you feel most alive.
author: — Anon

text: This is your adventure.
author: — Anon

text: Today is the day to begin.
author: — Anon

text: Seek out the wondrous.
author: — Anon

text: Find adventure in every corner.
author: — Anon

text: Unleash your spirit.
author: — Anon

text: Make waves.
author: — Anon

text: Chase the sun.
author: — Anon

text: Live fully now.
author: — Anon

text: The wild is calling.
author: — Anon

text: Your life, your adventure.
author: — Anon

text: Step into wonder.
author: — Anon

text: Shake up your life.
author: — Anon

text: Set your soul on fire.
author: — Anon

text: Be bold, be brave.
author: — Anon

text: Go wild.
author: — Anon

text: The purpose of life, after all, is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: A man on a horse is spiritually as well as physically bigger than a man on foot.
author: John Steinbeck

text: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: Augustine of Hippo

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure.
author: Christopher McCandless

text: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness.
author: Mark Twain

text: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Andre Gide

text: It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.
author: Sir Edmund Hillary

text: To see the world, things dangerous to come to, to see behind walls, draw closer, to find each other, and to feel. That is the purpose of life.
author: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty

text: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

text: If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine; it is lethal.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Travel makes one modest. You see what a tiny place you occupy in the world.
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Don't tell me how educated you are, tell me how much you have traveled.
author: Mohammed

text: Once a year, go someplace you've never been before.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Our battered suitcases were piled on the sidewalk again; we had longer ways to go. But no matter, the road is life.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: The goal is to die with memories, not dreams.
author: — Anon

text: It's a big world out there, it would be a shame not to experience it.
author: — Anon

text: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: What is life but one grand adventure?
author: — Anon

text: The danger of adventure is worth a thousand days of ease and comfort.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The most beautiful in the world is, of course, the world itself.
author: Wallace Stevens

text: I travel because it makes me realize how much I haven't seen, how much I'm not going to see, and how much I still have to see.
author: Pico Iyer

text: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: Because in the end, you won't remember the time you spent working in the office or mowing your lawn. Climb that goddamn mountain.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
author: Lao Tzu

text: One's destination is never a place, but a new way of seeing things.
author: Henry Miller

text: We travel not to escape life, but for life not to escape us.
author: — Anon

text: There's a whole world out there, right outside your window. You'd be a fool to miss it.
author: Charlotte Eriksson

text: You can't find happiness at the end of your journey, if you didn't bring it with you all along.
author: Katrina Mayer

text: The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.
author: W.B. Yeats

text: And then there is the most dangerous risk of all — the risk of spending your life not doing what you want on the bet you can buy yourself the freedom to do it later.
author: Randy Komisar

text: Life is a journey, not a destination.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: Adventure is a path. Real adventure – self-determined, self-motivated, often risky – forces you to have firsthand encounters with the world.
author: Mark Jenkins

text: I am not an adventurer by choice but by fate.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: I travel a lot; I hate having my life disrupted by routine.
author: Caskie Stinnett

text: So shut up, live, travel, adventure, bless, and don't be sorry.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: It is only in adventure that some people succeed in knowing themselves – in finding themselves.
author: Andre Gide

text: Adventure isn't all about rowing oceans or climbing mountains. Adventure in its purest form is simply a way of thinking.
author: Alastair Humphreys

text: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: An adventurous life does not necessarily mean climbing mountains, swimming with sharks, or jumping off cliffs. It means risking yourself by leaving a little piece of you behind in all those you meet along the way.
author: Shawna Grapentin

text: Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Better to die on your feet than live on your knees.
author: Emiliano Zapata

text: May your adventures bring you closer together, even as they take you far away from home.
author: Trenton Lee Stewart

text: Instead of trying to make your life perfect, give yourself the freedom to make it an adventure, and go ever upward.
author: Drew Houston

text: If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Every man can transform the world from one of monotony and drabness to one of excitement and adventure.
author: Irving Wallace

text: Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: The best way to know a city is to eat it.
author: Scott Westerfeld

text: Then one day, when you least expect it, the great adventure finds you.
author: Ewan McGregor

text: Adventure is allowing the unexpected to happen to you. Exploration is experiencing what you have not experienced before.
author: Richard Aldington

text: Go, fly, roam, travel, voyage, explore, journey, discover, adventure.
author: — Anon

text: It's about the journey, not the destination. But the destination is a good excuse for the journey.
author: — Anon

text: I don't know where I'm going, but I'm on my way.
author: Carl Sandburg

text: Oh, the places you'll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: A journey is best measured in friends, rather than miles.
author: Tim Cahill

text: Stop worrying about the potholes in the road and enjoy the journey.
author: Babs Hoffman

text: We must venture out of the harbor of commonplaceness and into the rough waters of adventure.
author: Wilferd Peterson

text: If happiness is the goal – and it should be, then adventures should be a priority.
author: Richard Branson

text: Attitude is the difference between an ordeal and an adventure.
author: — Anon

text: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I – I took the one less traveled by.
author: Robert Frost

text: It feels good to be lost in the right direction.
author: — Anon

text: People don't take trips, trips take people.
author: John Steinbeck

text: Once the travel bug bites there is no known antidote, and I know that I shall be happily infected until the end of my life.
author: Michael Palin

text: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: A person susceptible to 'wanderlust' is not so much addicted to movement as committed to transformation.
author: Pico Iyer

text: I'm in love with cities I've never been to and people I've never met.
author: John Green

text: Traveling – it leaves you speechless, then turns you into a storyteller.
author: Ibn Battuta

text: Don't die without embracing the daring adventure your life was meant to be.
author: Steve Pavlina

text: It's never too late to have a life you're proud of.
author: — Anon

text: The adrenaline and stress of an adventure are better than a thousand peaceful days.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Do more things that make you forget to check your phone.
author: — Anon

text: Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer.
author: — Anon

text: Life is a fatal adventure. It can only have one end. So why not make it as far-ranging and free as possible?
author: Alexander Eliot

text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: You do not travel if you are afraid of the unknown, you travel for the unknown, that reveals you with yourself.
author: Ella Maillart

text: Own only what you can always carry with you: know languages, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

text: I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: A man practices the art of adventure when he breaks the chain of routine and renews his life through reading new books, traveling to new places, making new friends, taking up new hobbies and adopting new viewpoints.
author: Wilfred Peterson

text: The sea is emotion incarnate. It loves, hates, and weeps. It defies all attempts to capture it with words and rejects all shackles. No matter what you say about it, there is always that which you can't.
author: Christopher Paolini

text: You are the artist of your own life. Don't hand the paintbrush to anyone else.
author: — Anon

text: The desire to fly is an idea handed down to us by our ancestors who, in their grueling travels across trackless lands in prehistoric times, looked enviously on the birds soaring freely through space, at full speed, above all obstacles, on the infinite highway of the air.
author: Wilbur Wright

text: Of all the books in the world, the best stories are found between the pages of a passport.
author: — Anon

text: Blessed are the curious for they shall have adventures.
author: Lovelle Drachman

text: Travel is never a matter of money, but of courage.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: I'm not lost, I'm exploring.
author: — Anon

text: The universe has a plan for you, and it's called adventure.
author: — Anon

text: You are not in the mountains. The mountains are in you.
author: John Muir

text: It's time to say goodbye to the comfort zone and hello to the adventure zone.
author: — Anon

text: I'm a travel addict on the road to recovery. Just kidding, I'm on the road to the airport.
author: — Anon

text: There are no foreign lands. It is the traveler only who is foreign.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: The world is big and I want to have a good look at it before it gets dark.
author: John Muir

text: And at the end of the day, your feet should be dirty, your hair messy and your eyes sparkling.
author: Shanti

text: If you're twenty-two, physically fit, hungry to learn and be better, I urge you to travel – as far and as widely as possible. Sleep on floors if you have to. Find out how other people live and eat and cook. Learn from them – wherever you go.
author: Anthony Bourdain

text: Live your life, do your work, then take your hat.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Don't let the fear of what could happen make nothing happen.
author: — Anon

text: The cost of not following your heart, is spending the rest of your life wishing you had.
author: — Anon

text: The only trip you will regret is the one you didn't take.
author: — Anon

text: Some beautiful paths can't be discovered without getting lost.
author: Erol Ozan

text: I would rather own a little and see the world than own the world and see a little of it.
author: Alexander Sattler

text: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: If you want to know the truth of who you are, walk until not a person knows your name. Travel is the great leveler, the great teacher, bitter as medicine, crueler than a mirror. A long stretch of road will teach you more about yourself than a hundred years of quiet.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

text: Adventure is not in a guidebook. It's in your soul.
author: — Anon

text: Don't listen to what they say. Go see.
author: — Anon

text: I love the feeling of being anonymous in a city I've never been before.
author: — Anon

text: Don't quit your daydream.
author: — Anon

text: We have nothing to lose and a world to see.
author: — Anon

text: Let's find some beautiful place to get lost.
author: — Anon

text: Go and see all you possibly can.
author: — Anon

text: May your choices reflect your hopes, not your fears.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The best stories are lived, not told.
author: — Anon

text: Your mountain is waiting, so get on your way.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: When in doubt, travel.
author: — Anon

text: Don't be a tourist, be a traveler.
author: — Anon

text: Get out there and live a little.
author: — Anon

text: We must take adventures in order to know where we truly belong.
author: — Anon

text: The free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
author: Charles Bukowski

text: The greatest adventure is what lies ahead.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The man who goes alone can start today; but he who travels with another must wait till that other is ready.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Remember that happiness is a way of travel – not a destination.
author: Roy M. Goodman

text: I am not the same, having seen the moon shine on the other side of the world.
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

text: There is a kind of magicness about going far away and then coming back all changed.
author: Kate Douglas Wiggin

text: Travel opens your heart, broadens your mind, and fills your life with stories to tell.
author: — Anon

text: The best journeys in life are those that answer questions you never thought to ask.
author: Rich Ridgeway

text: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
author: Albert Camus

text: Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don't be sorry.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: Life is for deep kisses, strange adventures, midnight swims and rambling conversations.
author: — Anon

text: I see my path, but I don't know where it leads. Not knowing where I'm going is what inspires me to travel it.
author: Rosalia de Castro

text: Some men see things as they are and say why. I dream things that never were and say why not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: This heart of mine was made to travel this world.
author: — Anon

text: And into the forest I go, to lose my mind and find my soul.
author: John Muir

text: The impulse to travel is one of the hopeful symptoms of life.
author: Agnes Repplier

text: At the end of your life, you will never regret not having passed one more test, not winning one more verdict or not closing one more deal. You will regret time not spent with a husband, a friend, a child, or a parent.
author: Barbara Bush

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Winning isn't everything, but wanting to win is.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.
author: Stephen R. Covey

text: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
author: Ayn Rand

text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
author: Alice Walker

text: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: Certain things catch your eye, but pursue only those that capture the heart.
author: Ancient Indian Proverb

text: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone can see.
author: Confucius

text: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
author: Anne Frank

text: Tough times never last, but tough people do.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
author: Coco Chanel

text: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: If you're offered a seat on a rocket ship, don't ask what seat! Just get on.
author: Sheryl Sandberg

text: I've been absolutely terrified every moment of my life - and I've never let it keep me from doing a single thing I wanted to do.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

text: You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The question is not what you look at, but what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don't try.
author: Beverly Sills

text: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
author: Gloria Steinem

text: It's your place in the world; it's your life. Go on and do all you can with it, and make it the life you want to live.
author: Mae Jemison

text: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
author: Bob Dylan

text: I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear.
author: Rosa Parks

text: First, have a definite, clear practical ideal; a goal, an objective. Second, have the necessary means to achieve your ends; wisdom, money, materials, and methods. Third, adjust all your means to that end.
author: Aristotle

text: You can't put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the farther you get.
author: Michael Phelps

text: We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea.
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.
author: Estée Lauder

text: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the water to create many ripples.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse.
author: Florence Nightingale

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

text: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
author: Henry Ford

text: I never worry about the future. It comes soon enough.
author: Albert Einstein

text: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
author: Henry Ford

text: I never worry about the future. It comes soon enough.
author: Albert Einstein
